feed.title: Firefox Nightly Notes
feed.subtitle: Firefox Nightly gets a new version every day and as a consequence, the release notes for the Nightly channel are updated continuously to reflect features that have reached sufficient maturity to benefit from community feedback and bug reports.

entry.title: Starting with Firefox 115, Nightly users without platform support for H264 video decoding can...

content.div:
115.0a1 / New / Bug 1832568
Starting with Firefox 115, Nightly users without platform support for H264 video decoding can now fallback to Cisco's OpenH264 plugin for playback.

entry.title: On Linux, middle clicks on the new tab button will now open the xclipboard contents in the new...

content.div:
115.0a1 / Changed / Bug 1418462
On Linux, middle clicks on the new tab button will now open the xclipboard contents in the new tab. If the xclipboard content is a URL then that URL is opened, any other text is opened with your default search provider.
This feature can be turned off using browser.tabs.searchclipboardfor.middleclick in about:config.

entry.title: DOM: Added support for ES Modules on DedicatedWorker and SharedWorker

content.div:
114.0a1 / Web Platform / Bug 1812591
DOM: Added support for ES Modules on DedicatedWorker and SharedWorker

entry.title: It is now possible to reorder the extensions listed in the extensions panel.

content.div:
114.0a1 / New / Bug 1805924
It is now possible to reorder the extensions listed in the extensions panel.

entry.title: DNS over HTTPS settings are now part of the Privacy & Security section of the Settings page...

content.div:
114.0a1 / Changed / Bug 1610741
DNS over HTTPS settings are now part of the Privacy & Security section of the Settings page and allow the user to choose from all the supported modes.

entry.title: Added UI to manage the DNS over HTTPS exception list.

content.div:
114.0a1 / New / Bug 1596847
Added UI to manage the DNS over HTTPS exception list.

entry.title: Bookmarks can now be searched from the Bookmarks menu. The Bookmarks menu is accessible by...

content.div:
114.0a1 / New / Bug 1736937
Bookmarks can now be searched from the Bookmarks menu. The Bookmarks menu is accessible by adding the Bookmarks menu button to the toolbar.

entry.title: Restrict searches to your local browsing history by selecting Search history from the History,...

content.div:
114.0a1 / New / Bug 1736939
Restrict searches to your local browsing history by selecting Search history from the History, Library or Application menu buttons.

entry.title: Mac users can now capture video from their cameras in all supported native resolutions. This...

content.div:
114.0a1 / New / Bug 1806604
Mac users can now capture video from their cameras in all supported native resolutions. This enables resolutions higher than 1280x720.

entry.title: Say hello to enhanced Picture-in-Picture! Rewind, check video duration, and effortlessly switch...

content.div:
113.0a1 / New / Bug 1778801
Say hello to enhanced Picture-in-Picture! Rewind, check video duration, and effortlessly switch to full-screen mode on the web's most popular video websites.

entry.title: Firefox 113 adds support for a number of WebRTC features for improved interoperability:...

content.div:
113.0a1 / Web Platform / Bug 1510802
Firefox 113 adds support for a number of WebRTC features for improved interoperability: RTCMediaSourceStats, RTCPeerConnectionState, RTCPeerConnectionStats ("peer-connection" RTCStatsType), RTCRtpSender.setStreams(), and RTCSctpTransport.

entry.title: For all ETP Strict users, we extended the list of known tracking parameters that are removed...

content.div:
112.0a1 / New / Bug 1773983
For all ETP Strict users, we extended the list of known tracking parameters that are removed from URLs to further protect our users from cross-site tracking.

entry.title: Starting with Firefox 112, Nightly users on macOS and Linux can now use FIDO2 / WebAuthn...

content.div:
115.0a1 / New / Bug 1814487
Starting with Firefox 112, Nightly users on macOS and Linux can now use FIDO2 / WebAuthn authenticators over USB. Some advanced features, such as fully passwordless logins, require a PIN to be set on the authenticator. It is expected to ship to all users in a future release.

entry.title: Starting with Firefox 113, Nightly and early beta builds now behave similar to the other...

content.div:
115.0a1 / Web Platform / Bug 1820116
Starting with Firefox 113, Nightly and early beta builds now behave similar to the other browsers when splitting a node (e.g., typing Enter to split a paragraph) and joining two nodes (e.g., typing Backspace at start of a paragraph to join the paragraph and the previous one) when using the built-in editor. When a node is split, the built-in editor creates new node after the original one, i.e., creates the right node. Similarly, when two nodes are joined, the built-in editor deletes the latter node and moves its children to end of the preceding node.
This new behavior can also be enabled by web apps themselves for all channels with a call of document.execCommand("enableCompatibleJoinSplitDirection", false, "false") (introduced in bug 1810663). This command is available only when designMode is set to "on" or there is at least one editable element which has contenteditable attribute, and the built-in editor has not handled the insertParagraph, delete, or forwardDelete command.

entry.title: Starting with Firefox 113, the WebTransport API is now enabled in the Nightly channel, including...

content.div:
115.0a1 / Web Platform / Bug 1818754
Starting with Firefox 113, the WebTransport API is now enabled in the Nightly channel, including RFC 9297 support. It's expected to ship to release in the near future. WebTransport is expected to see widespread use for media delivery and other applications. WebTransport is built on top of QUIC/HTTP3 and provides reliable streams and reliable and unreliable datagrams.

entry.title: The Awesomebar result menu is now enabled in Firefox Nightly, allowing you to remove history...

content.div:
113.0a1 / New / Bug 1789661
The Awesomebar result menu is now enabled in Firefox Nightly, allowing you to remove history results and dismiss sponsored Firefox Suggest results.

entry.title: The forced-color-adjust property is now supported, allowing authors to opt an element out of...

content.div:
113.0a1 / Web Platform / Bug 1818819
The forced-color-adjust property is now supported, allowing authors to opt an element out of color changes in Forced Color Mode for improved readability where the automatically-picked contrasting colors are not ideal.

entry.title: Passwords generated in Firefox now include special characters, making them more secure.

content.div:
113.0a1 / New / Bug 1559986
Passwords generated in Firefox now include special characters, making them more secure.

entry.title: AV1 Image Format files containing animations (AVIS) are now supported, improving Firefox'...

content.div:
113.0a1 / New / Bug 1825580
AV1 Image Format files containing animations (AVIS) are now supported, improving Firefox' support for AVIF images across the web.

entry.title: On Windows, the elastic overscroll effect is now enabled by default, with two fingers scrolling...

content.div:
113.0a1 / New / Bug 1810641
On Windows, the elastic overscroll effect is now enabled by default, with two fingers scrolling on touchpad or scrolling on touchscreen, you will see a bouncing animation when scrolling past the edge of a scroll container.

entry.title: Firefox now supports the scripting CSS media query.

content.div:
113.0a1 / Web Platform / Bug 1166581
Firefox now supports the scripting CSS media query.

entry.title: Following up on the work already shipped on macOS and Linux in Firefox 110, GPU-accelerated...

content.div:
113.0a1 / New / Bug 1825182
Following up on the work already shipped on macOS and Linux in Firefox 110, GPU-accelerated Canvas2D is now enabled by default for Firefox for Android also.

entry.title: Firefox for Android now supports hardware accelerated AV1 video decoding by default with...

content.div:
113.0a1 / New
Firefox for Android now supports hardware accelerated AV1 video decoding by default with supported hardware or via fallback to software decoding.

entry.title: Websites that use window.print() can now be printed in Firefox for Android.

content.div:
113.0a1 / New / Bug 1659818
Websites that use window.print() can now be printed in Firefox for Android.

entry.title: Mac users can now access macOS Services directly from the context menu.

content.div:
113.0a1 / New / Bug 660452
Mac users can now access macOS Services directly from the context menu.

entry.title: Removed the long-deprecated mozRTCPeerConnection, mozRTCIceCandidate, and...

content.div:
113.0a1 / Changed / Bug 1531812
Removed the long-deprecated mozRTCPeerConnection, mozRTCIceCandidate, and mozRTCSessionDescription types. Sites should utilize the non-prefixed variants instead.

entry.title: A 13-year-old feature request was fulfilled, and Firefox now supports files being...

content.div:
113.0a1 / New / Bug 580928
A 13-year-old feature request was fulfilled, and Firefox now supports files being drag-and-dropped directly from Microsoft Outlook. A special thanks to volunteer contributor Marco Spiess for helping to get this across the finish line!

entry.title: Firefox now supports the color functions from the color (level 4) specification. This includes...

content.div:
113.0a1 / Web Platform / Bug 1352753
Firefox now supports the color functions from the color (level 4) specification. This includes the lab(), lch(), oklab(), oklch() and color() functions.

entry.title: The Windows GPU sandbox first shipped in the Firefox 110 release has been tightened to enhance...

content.div:
113.0a1 / New / Bug 1822308
The Windows GPU sandbox first shipped in the Firefox 110 release has been tightened to enhance the security benefits it provides.

entry.title: Module scripts can now import other ES module scripts on worklets.

content.div:
113.0a1 / Web Platform / Bug 1572644
Module scripts can now import other ES module scripts on worklets.

entry.title: Importing bookmarks from Safari or a Chrome-based browser? The favicons for those bookmarks will...

content.div:
113.0a1 / New / Bug 326701
Importing bookmarks from Safari or a Chrome-based browser? The favicons for those bookmarks will now also be imported by default to make them easier to identify.

entry.title: The deprecated U2F Javascript API is now disabled by default. The U2F protocol remains usable...

content.div:
112.0a1 / Changed / Bug 1809333
The deprecated U2F Javascript API is now disabled by default. The U2F protocol remains usable through the WebAuthn API. The U2F API can be re-enabled using the security.webauth.u2f preference.

entry.title: Do you use the tab list panel in the tab bar? If so, you can now close tabs by middle-clicking...

content.div:
112.0a1 / New / Bug 953217
Do you use the tab list panel in the tab bar? If so, you can now close tabs by middle-clicking items in that list.

entry.title: You've always been able to un-close a tab by using (Cmd/Ctrl)-Shift-T. Now, that same shortcut...

content.div:
112.0a1 / New / Bug 1423125
You've always been able to un-close a tab by using (Cmd/Ctrl)-Shift-T. Now, that same shortcut will restore the previous session if there are no more closed tabs from the same session to re-open.

entry.title: Right-clicking on password fields now shows an option to reveal the password.

content.div:
112.0a1 / New / Bug 1816988
Right-clicking on password fields now shows an option to reveal the password.

entry.title: “Clear” button, newly added to the date picker panel, allows users to quickly clear the input...

content.div:
112.0a1 / Web Platform / Bug 1811187
“Clear” button, newly added to the date picker panel, allows users to quickly clear the input with type “date“ or “datetime-local” and provides familiar experience across browsers.

entry.title: Ubuntu Linux users can now import their browser data from the Chromium Snap package. Currently,...

content.div:
112.0a1 / New / Bug 1467094
Ubuntu Linux users can now import their browser data from the Chromium Snap package. Currently, this will only work if Firefox is not also installed as a Snap package, but work is underway to address this!

entry.title: Use of the rel attribute is now supported on form elements, allowing the specification of the...

content.div:
111.0a1 / Web Platform / Bug 1509346
Use of the rel attribute is now supported on form elements, allowing the specification of the relationship between the current document and the form target in a simpler, cross-browser way.

entry.title: Windows native notifications are now enabled by default.

content.div:
111.0a1 / New / Bug 1497425
Windows native notifications are now enabled by default.
